review_title: Voted one of the best place to work.
job_title: Utilization Management in Charleston, SC
pros: It was a great atmosphere. The work was great and the pay was good. Teammates are some of the best in the world. Long lasting friendships were formed here.
cons: The company culture took a turn for the worst with the original CEO retired and sold the company.

job_title: Member Services in Charleston, SC
pros: Charleston office fantastic place to work.
cons: Corporate policies were nonsensical and prevent success.

job_title: Provider Network Manager in Charleston, SC
pros: Stability and committed organization to the community
cons: None, good company with long term employees

review_title: Great benefits, work from home opportunities
job_title: Care Connector in Charleston, SC
pros: Great benefits, work from home.
cons: Not a lot of chance for advancing. Rules change constantly for job.

job_title: MSW in Charleston, SC
pros: Good benefits and salary with this job
cons: No cons or complaints with this job.

review_title: Be aware of payroll stealing your money
job_title: Customer Care Representative in Charleston, SC
pros: Good medical.  If you have a good supervisor, youll be ok.
cons:
Too many scripts that people don't want to hear
 They just want you to fix their issue.
Payroll will steal your money. I work the late shift. The company policy days since my shift startd after 12, I get a diferential.
Bec I work over time for a few dsys and started to work at 10 a.m. they did not pay me my diferential. The overtime started at 10, my shift is my normal shift at 12:30pm.
Nothing you can do about it, payroll said no and thats  it.
401k is not much. You pay fees for loans etc.
The FMLA is not that good either.
If you have the night shift is hard to get PTO.

job_title: Clinical Care Nurse/Utilization Mgt in Charleston, SC
pros: You can work from home after 6-9 months in the office. They have good health insurance benefits.
cons: They are very disorganized. Their initial and ongoing training lacks any real substance when it comes to preparing you for the job. The policies and protocols are ever changing and employees are not made aware of the changes until after theyn have done the process by the previous way then are told that is not right. they set productivity levels at unattainable levels so that they always have a way to get rid of people that don't fit into the clique. Exempt employees are expected to work overtime in amou8nts needed to meet the unreasonable productivity standards set by the manager. They only hire those who take short cuts and lie. They embellish quantity not quality, in their employees.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Charleston, SC
pros: Good Environment, great management team
cons: It's a lot of information and procedures, Quality it's too strict and will deduct points for little things. Which causes a lot of disengagement.  Quality grid should be review and updated.

job_title: Care Manager in Charleston, SC
pros: good insurance package and holiday schedule. company involvement in community enrichment projects and opportunity for staff to be involved.
cons: micromanagement with punitive policies.  self motivation is minimized due to negative management style and stark hierarchy. lack of creativity. supplies are minimum and have to bring in some of your own

job_title: Account Executive in Charleston, SC
pros: Great benefits package and extra perks in the home office, like mini massages.
cons: unrealistic job duties. You would have to work 24 hours a day and would never get caught up. Configuration issues dominate the majority of your time and no one takes ownership and fixes the problems.

job_title: Member Services Representative in Charleston, SC
pros: Good benefits, clean environment, corporate advancement, fun environment, own equipment
cons: Low pay, lack of diversity, long time to move up the corporate ladder, benefits are hard to access during times of need.

job_title: Member Service Representative in North Charleston, SC
pros: Wonderful benefits (tuition reimbursement, comprehensive medical, dental/vision), Guaranteed hours, Flexible PTO options
cons: SERIOUS micromanagement, non-flexible schedules (you are given times to have break and use the restroom etc. You are held to strict adherence)

review_title: My experience with Select Health has been wonderful.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Charleston, SC
pros: Great company to work for.  Opportunities for growth.
cons: Nothing to report at this time.

job_title: IT Analyst in North Charleston, SC
pros: Great working environment with lots of kind co-workers.  Family atmosphere. ...
cons: None.  I loved working at this company..

job_title: Member Service Representative in Charleston, SC
pros: Great Benefits and your work day goes by fast most of the time. Great atmospher
cons: A lot of gossiping among employess

job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Charleston, SC
pros: Select Health of SC is a great company
cons: I do not have any cons

job_title: UM Case Manager in North Charleston, SC
pros: Coworkers are great and Benefits
cons: PRODUCTIVITY  IS KING - NOTHING ELSE MATTERS

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Charleston, SC
pros: Great Member Services management team
cons: Corporate increasing involvement with all departments

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Charleston, SC
pros: The benefits package is awesome.
cons: Nepotism,  sectionalism, intimidation and ethnic bias.

job_title: UM Case Manager in Charleston, SC
pros: good benefits, environment maintained and location good
cons: Poor leadership and employees are NOT respected and DO NOT want to be heard
